title.narrative: SUPPLY OF QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE EARLY LEARNING AND EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2.2: By 2023, Government and partners have increased capacity to provide quality and inclusive early learning and education for children and adolescents, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 201: By 2023, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, increasingly benefit from quality, inclusive and gender- responsive education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: By 2023, Government and partners have increased capacity to provide quality and inclusive early learning andeducation for children and adolescents

description.narrative: UNICEF’s advocacy, technical expertise, and provision of critical COVID-19 preventive supplies and facilities helped to ensure a safe environment for 8,915 preschoolers when ECCD centres reopened in March 2021. Despite the challenges of COVID-19, UNICEF continued its support for upstream work for multisectoral ECCD and national education reform while at the same time helped to increase access to ECCD centres and inclusive education, as well as improve the quality of early learning through capacity development support for ECCD stakeholders and teachers from SEN schools.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;; ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;&nbs | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
